Every week, there will be a new set of exercises, which we will solve mostly together in the tutorial. Some tasks will be theoretical and others will be programming exercises. In order to work on the programming exercises, you need to have a
distribution available on your computer. The programming will be done via
(https://jupyter.org/), which means you need to install the package jupyter within your Python 3 environment. Ideally, you start familiarizing yourself with Python and Jupyter.

The programming in Python will be basic and prior knowledge is not required. Our main goal in the tutorial is to revisit and better understand what has been done in the lecture and the programming should be regarded a tool, we have to use in order to do so.
The tutorial tasksheet will be available one week prior to the tutorial and the solution uploaded on saturdays!
